A4.text: His seminal 1947 collage I was a Rich Man's Plaything is considered the earliest standard bearer representing Pop Art.

A5.text: In a series of works he explored and extended the possibilities and limits of the silkscreen medium.

A6.text: Eduardo Paolozzi's Last Public Sculpture on YouTube

A7.text: The work was assembled with cuttings from American magazines and advertisements, mounted on card.

A8.text: They were also included in the 45 'BUNK!' collages reproduced as screenprints in a collection published in 1972.
